intro: Oxystelma alpini, commonly known as the alpine oxystelma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Oxystelma alpini is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh alpine conditions.
